newsitem.title: USA: Laser Storm says sacks president Bauerle.
newsitem.headline: Laser Storm says sacks president Bauerle.

text.p: Laser Storm Inc said Friday that it has fired President William Bauerle as part of a management overall in what it calls an aggressive move to return the company to profitability.

The company said in a statement that Bauerle, who also served as chief operating officer and secretary, will remain on the board of directors and is standing for re-election. His responsibilities were primarily in the production area of the laser tag game equipment maker, the company said.
Laser Storm's chairman and chief executive officer Bob Cooney was named president and secretary by the board.

Laser Storm says it has reduced its corporate staff to its lowest levels since 1994 as part of its restructuring and continues to look for areas where it can cut overhead and sell off non-strategic assets.

Part of that movement means outsourcing of production, Bauerle explained. "The vendor selected to provide product and services, formerly produced in-house, has allowed Laser Storm to eliminate its production staff while increasing quality and increasing gross margins," he said in a company statement.

"The subsequent reduction in my job responsibilities made it possible for the board of directors to reduce executive overhead through my release. Remaining on the board will allow me to continue to give input towards corporate finance related issues, another principal of my expertise."
